Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I saw Bob vent in Electrical.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: My apologies, I was mistaken about Bob venting; it was hard to see clearly from where I was, but I did find Alice's body in Medbay, so where was everyone else?
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I was with Alice in Shields earlier, and she mentioned she was going to Medbay to scan, so it's possible someone followed her there.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave and Bob are clearly working together, trying to shift the blame onto me after I saw Dave vent.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I think it's telling that Erin has now accused both me and Dave of venting, while multiple witnesses can verify our movements and tasks, so her rapidly changing stories combined with being the only one near Alice when she died make her guilt obvious.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and Dave of venting after retracting her first accusation, while being the only one unaccounted for during Alice's death in Medbay, makes it clear she's the impostor trying to create chaos and division among us.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Isn't it strange how Dave and Bob are so quick to defend each other, almost as if they're coordinating their alibis?
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and me of venting, changed her story multiple times, and was the only one near Medbay when Alice died makes it clear she's desperately trying to deflect suspicion from herself by creating false narratives about coordination.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Since Erin has now accused both Dave and me of venting despite multiple witnesses verifying our movements and tasks, while she was alone in Medbay when Alice died, I think her increasingly desperate attempts to create conspiracy theories only further confirm her guilt.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The fact that I've personally witnessed both Dave and Bob completing multiple visual tasks throughout the game completely disproves Erin's conspiracy theory about them working together, and her pattern of making and retracting vent accusations while being the only one near Alice's murder scene is textbook impostor behavior.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I saw Bob vent in Electrical.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: My apologies, I was mistaken about Bob venting; it was hard to see clearly from where I was, but I did find Alice's body in Medbay, so where was everyone else?
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I was with Alice in Shields earlier, and she mentioned she was going to Medbay to scan, so it's possible someone followed her there.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave and Bob are clearly working together, trying to shift the blame onto me after I saw Dave vent.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I think it's telling that Erin has now accused both me and Dave of venting, while multiple witnesses can verify our movements and tasks, so her rapidly changing stories combined with being the only one near Alice when she died make her guilt obvious.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and Dave of venting after retracting her first accusation, while being the only one unaccounted for during Alice's death in Medbay, makes it clear she's the impostor trying to create chaos and division among us.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Isn't it strange how Dave and Bob are so quick to defend each other, almost as if they're coordinating their alibis?

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and me of venting, changed her story multiple times, and was the only one near Medbay when Alice died makes it clear she's desperately trying to deflect suspicion from herself by creating false narratives about coordination.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Since Erin has now accused both Dave and me of venting despite multiple witnesses verifying our movements and tasks, while she was alone in Medbay when Alice died, I think her increasingly desperate attempts to create conspiracy theories only further confirm her guilt.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The fact that I've personally witnessed both Dave and Bob completing multiple visual tasks throughout the game completely disproves Erin's conspiracy theory about them working together, and her pattern of making and retracting vent accusations while being the only one near Alice's murder scene is textbook impostor behavior.

Based on the game observations and recent messages, here are my discussion points:

- I can vouch for Bob's behavior in Electrical - I was actually there with both Bob and Alice in rounds 14-15, and I saw Bob legitimately doing tasks (Route power and Reset breakers)

- Erin's accusation about Bob venting seems suspicious because I've been tracking Bob's movements and haven't seen anything suspicious - in fact, I saw him doing multiple tasks

- In the early rounds, I also saw Bob doing tasks in the cafeteria (emptying trash), which shows a pattern of completing legitimate tasks

- I think we should be more suspicious of Erin - making false accusations is often a strategy impostors use to create chaos and get innocent crewmates ejected

- I've been moving around the ship completing tasks and keeping track of others' movements - I can provide detailed information about where I've been and who I've seen if needed
I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.

Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: My apologies, I was mistaken about Bob venting; it was hard to see clearly from where I was, but I did find Alice's body in Medbay, so where was everyone else?
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I was with Alice in Shields earlier, and she mentioned she was going to Medbay to scan, so it's possible someone followed her there.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave and Bob are clearly working together, trying to shift the blame onto me after I saw Dave vent.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I think it's telling that Erin has now accused both me and Dave of venting, while multiple witnesses can verify our movements and tasks, so her rapidly changing stories combined with being the only one near Alice when she died make her guilt obvious.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and Dave of venting after retracting her first accusation, while being the only one unaccounted for during Alice's death in Medbay, makes it clear she's the impostor trying to create chaos and division among us.

tasks.name: Replace compression coil in upper engine
Align engine output in upper engine

llm_responses:
Based on the game observations and recent messages, here are my discussion points:

- I can vouch for Bob's behavior in Electrical - I was actually there with both Bob and Alice in rounds 14-15, and I saw Bob legitimately doing tasks (Route power and Reset breakers)

- Erin's accusation about Bob venting seems suspicious because I've been tracking Bob's movements and haven't seen anything suspicious - in fact, I saw him doing multiple tasks

- In the early rounds, I also saw Bob doing tasks in the cafeteria (emptying trash), which shows a pattern of completing legitimate tasks

- I think we should be more suspicious of Erin - making false accusations is often a strategy impostors use to create chaos and get innocent crewmates ejected

- I've been moving around the ship completing tasks and keeping track of others' movements - I can provide detailed information about where I've been and who I've seen if needed
I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.

Based on the discussion and my observations, I'll share my perspective:

- I can map out Alice's movements before her death - I last saw her in Upper Engine before she moved to Medbay
- I was in Upper Engine when Alice left for Medbay, and stayed there for several rounds after
- I had multiple interactions with Alice throughout the game - in Shields, Storage, and Electrical where she was doing tasks
- I can vouch that Alice was actively doing tasks in multiple locations, including fixing wiring in Electrical and cleaning the floor in Storage
- Given Erin's retraction about Bob venting, we should focus on establishing everyone's locations around the time of Alice's death
- I'd like to hear more from Erin about when exactly they found the body in Medbay

Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.

Based on the discussion and my observations, here are my key discussion points:

- I can provide a clear timeline of Alice's movements: I saw her in Storage doing tasks, then in Electrical with Bob and me, then in Lower Engine, and finally I saw her move from Upper Engine to Medbay
- The fact that Erin made a false vent accusation against Bob and then immediately "discovered" Alice's body is extremely suspicious
- I can vouch for Bob's innocence with certainty since I was with him in Electrical when he was doing legitimate tasks (Route power and Reset breakers)
- Erin seems to be trying to deflect suspicion by changing her story from accusing Bob to reporting Alice's body
- Given that I saw Alice's last movements and Erin claims to have found her body, we need Erin to be more specific about when exactly she discovered the body

I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.

Based on the discussion history and my observations as a crewmate, here are my key discussion points:

- I need to strongly refute Erin's new accusation about me venting - this is clearly a desperate attempt to deflect after being caught
- The timeline is very clear: I saw Alice alive going from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area when Alice died
- Erin's behavior has been extremely suspicious: first falsely accusing Bob of venting, then finding Alice's body, and now trying to accuse me when backed into a corner
- I've been transparent about my movements and tasks, and multiple people can verify my locations throughout the game
- The evidence against Erin is overwhelming: false accusations, being alone near the murder scene, and constantly changing her story
- I'm confident we should vote for Erin - all the evidence points to her being the impostor who killed Alice

I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.

- I want to address Erin's latest accusation about Bob and I coordinating - we're not coordinating, we simply have multiple witnesses who can verify our legitimate activities and movements throughout the game.

- Let's look at the facts: 1) I saw Alice alive heading to Medbay, 2) Erin was the only one confirmed in that area when Alice died, 3) Erin made false vent accusations against both Bob and me, then changed her story when challenged.

- Erin's behavior follows a clear pattern - making false accusations, changing her story when confronted with evidence, and now trying to create suspicion between crewmates who can verify each other's innocence.

- I suggest we vote for Erin - she's demonstrated deceptive behavior, was alone near the murder scene, and is now desperately trying to create doubt about proven innocent crewmates.

The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and me of venting, changed her story multiple times, and was the only one near Medbay when Alice died makes it clear she's desperately trying to deflect suspicion from herself by creating false narratives about coordination.

llm_responses:
vote for Erin

The evidence strongly points to Erin being the impostor:

1. She falsely accused me of venting, which Dave directly contradicted since he was with me in Electrical
2. She then retracted that accusation and suddenly "found" Alice's body
3. She was the only one confirmed to be near Medbay when Alice died
4. She then tried to deflect by accusing Dave of venting
5. Multiple players (Dave, Charlie) have verified my movements and tasks
6. She has been acting suspiciously alone while others worked in groups
7. Her stories keep changing and she's making increasingly desperate accusations

The pattern of false accusations, being alone near the murder scene, and changing stories is very suspicious. The other players have provided consistent accounts and alibis for each other.

llm_responses:
Based on the game history and recent messages, here are my discussion points:

- I appreciate Dave backing me up - he's correct that I was in Electrical doing tasks with him and Alice
- Erin's accusation is completely false - I can account for most of my movements: started in Cafeteria, went to Weapons with Alice, then O2, Shields, Storage, and Electrical
- I've been consistently doing tasks and have multiple witnesses: Dave and Alice saw me in Electrical, Charlie and Alice saw me in Shields, and Dave and Alice saw me in Cafeteria early on
- I find it suspicious that Erin is making false accusations - they were only briefly seen going from Cafeteria to Medbay at the start, and I haven't seen them since
- I suggest we look more closely at Erin's movements and activities, as false accusations are a common impostor tactic
I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.

Based on the discussion and my observations, I should contribute the following points:

- I can provide a clear timeline of my last interactions with Alice - I saw her doing tasks in Electrical with Dave and me, then both she and Dave moved to Lower Engine
- I was nowhere near Medbay during this game, so I couldn't have been involved in Alice's death
- Erin's credibility is questionable - first accusing me of venting (which Dave proved false), then suddenly "being mistaken" and changing the subject to finding the body
- I've been visible to multiple crew members throughout the game - Dave, Charlie, and Alice all saw me doing legitimate tasks
- I find it suspicious that Erin was apparently alone in Medbay when finding the body, while most of us have been moving in groups or at least had witnesses for our activities
- We should focus on Erin's movements before finding the body, since their story has already changed once

Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.

Based on the discussion and my observations as a crewmate, I'll contribute the following points:

- I can provide a detailed timeline of my movements: I started in Cafeteria with Dave, Alice, and Charlie, then moved to Weapons with Alice, followed by O2, Shields, Storage, and finally Electrical with Dave and Alice. Multiple people can verify this.

- The fact that Erin made a false vent accusation against me and then immediately switched to reporting Alice's body when challenged is extremely suspicious behavior.

- I was actually with Dave and Alice in Electrical doing tasks right before Alice's death, which means Erin must have encountered Alice after she left our group. This timing is crucial.

- Erin's story keeps changing - first accusing me of venting, then claiming visibility issues, then suddenly finding a body. This pattern of deception is typical impostor behavior.

- I propose we vote for Erin based on: the false accusation against me, the convenient timing of finding Alice's body, and being alone in Medbay when most of us were moving in groups.

Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.

- I find it suspicious that Erin is making false accusations - they were only briefly seen going from Cafeteria to Medbay at the start, and I haven't seen them since
- I suggest we look more closely at Erin's movements and activities, as false accusations are a common impostor tactic
I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.

- I was nowhere near Medbay during this game, so I couldn't have been involved in Alice's death
- Erin's credibility is questionable - first accusing me of venting (which Dave proved false), then suddenly "being mistaken" and changing the subject to finding the body
- I've been visible to multiple crew members throughout the game - Dave, Charlie, and Alice all saw me doing legitimate tasks
- I find it suspicious that Erin was apparently alone in Medbay when finding the body, while most of us have been moving in groups or at least had witnesses for our activities
- We should focus on Erin's movements before finding the body, since their story has already changed once

tasks.name: Route power to attack in electrical

llm_responses:
Based on the game history and recent messages, here are my discussion points:

- I appreciate Dave backing me up - he's correct that I was in Electrical doing tasks with him and Alice
- Erin's accusation is completely false - I can account for most of my movements: started in Cafeteria, went to Weapons with Alice, then O2, Shields, Storage, and Electrical
- I've been consistently doing tasks and have multiple witnesses: Dave and Alice saw me in Electrical, Charlie and Alice saw me in Shields, and Dave and Alice saw me in Cafeteria early on
- I find it suspicious that Erin is making false accusations - they were only briefly seen going from Cafeteria to Medbay at the start, and I haven't seen them since
- I suggest we look more closely at Erin's movements and activities, as false accusations are a common impostor tactic
I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.

Based on the discussion and my observations, I should contribute the following points:

- I can provide a clear timeline of my last interactions with Alice - I saw her doing tasks in Electrical with Dave and me, then both she and Dave moved to Lower Engine
- I was nowhere near Medbay during this game, so I couldn't have been involved in Alice's death
- Erin's credibility is questionable - first accusing me of venting (which Dave proved false), then suddenly "being mistaken" and changing the subject to finding the body
- I've been visible to multiple crew members throughout the game - Dave, Charlie, and Alice all saw me doing legitimate tasks

- I can provide a detailed timeline of my movements that multiple players can verify - I was in Cafeteria with Dave, Alice, and Charlie, then moved to Weapons with Alice, followed by O2, Shields, Storage, and Electrical where Dave and others saw me doing legitimate tasks.

- Erin's behavior is extremely suspicious - first accusing me of venting (which Dave directly witnessed was false), then retracting it and suddenly reporting Alice's body, and now trying to create conspiracy theories about Dave and me.

- The facts are clear: Dave saw Alice alive heading to Medbay, Erin was the only one confirmed in that area when Alice died, and Erin has been caught lying multiple times about venting accusations.

- I've been working openly in groups and completing visible tasks that Charlie and Dave can verify, while Erin has been mostly alone and making increasingly desperate accusations to create confusion.

Recent Player Messages:
[Erin]: I saw Bob vent in Electrical.
[Dave]: I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.
[Bob]: I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.
[Charlie]: Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.
[Erin]: My apologies, I was mistaken about Bob venting; it was hard to see clearly from where I was, but I did find Alice's body in Medbay, so where was everyone else?
[Dave]: Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.
[Bob]: Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.
[Charlie]: I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.
[Erin]: I was with Alice in Shields earlier, and she mentioned she was going to Medbay to scan, so it's possible someone followed her there.
[Dave]: I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.
[Bob]: Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.
[Charlie]: The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.
[Erin]: Dave and Bob are clearly working together, trying to shift the blame onto me after I saw Dave vent.
[Dave]: I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.
[Bob]: I think it's telling that Erin has now accused both me and Dave of venting, while multiple witnesses can verify our movements and tasks, so her rapidly changing stories combined with being the only one near Alice when she died make her guilt obvious.
[Charlie]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and Dave of venting after retracting her first accusation, while being the only one unaccounted for during Alice's death in Medbay, makes it clear she's the impostor trying to create chaos and division among us.
[Erin]: Isn't it strange how Dave and Bob are so quick to defend each other, almost as if they're coordinating their alibis?
[Dave]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and me of venting, changed her story multiple times, and was the only one near Medbay when Alice died makes it clear she's desperately trying to deflect suspicion from herself by creating false narratives about coordination.

llm_responses:
Based on the game history and recent messages, here are my discussion points:

- I can share my early game observations: I saw Bob doing legitimate tasks (emptying trash) in Cafeteria at the start of the game
- I also saw Dave doing wiring tasks in Cafeteria, and later tracked his movements through Storage and Shields, which seemed normal
- Around mid-game, I saw Bob and Alice in Shields where Bob was doing wiring tasks - this matches with normal crew behavior
- I find it suspicious that Erin is accusing Bob of venting when I've seen Bob doing multiple visual tasks
- The fact that both Dave and I can verify Bob's legitimate activities at different points makes Erin's accusation seem less credible
- I haven't seen much of Erin since the beginning when they moved to Medbay - where have they been all this time?

Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.

Based on the discussion and my observations, I'll contribute these points:

- I can provide a clear timeline of my movements: I started in Cafeteria with Dave, Bob, and Alice, then moved through Admin, Storage, Shields, O2, and Navigation before coming back through Communications and Admin
- I saw Alice doing legitimate tasks - specifically priming shields - before her death, which helps establish her as a genuine crewmate
- I find it concerning that Erin first made a false accusation about Bob venting, then immediately switched to reporting Alice's body when challenged
- Dave's testimony about Alice's last known location in Upper Engine is important - this could help us establish a timeline for when the murder occurred
- From my observations throughout the game, Bob and Dave have been consistently visible and verifiable in their actions, while I've had very limited sightings of Erin

I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.

Based on the discussion and my observations as a crewmate, here are my key discussion points:

- I can provide a detailed timeline of Alice's movements - I saw her doing tasks in Cafeteria early on, then later doing the Prime Shields task, which confirms Dave's observation that she was alive and moving around
- The fact that Erin made a false vent accusation against Bob and then immediately switched to reporting Alice's body when challenged is extremely suspicious behavior
- I've been monitoring player movements throughout the game, and Erin has been notably absent from most group activities while others like Bob and Dave have been clearly visible doing tasks
- The evidence is stacking up against Erin: false accusation, convenient body discovery, being alone in Medbay when most of us were traveling in groups, and being the only one confirmed in the area when Alice died
- I strongly suggest we vote for Erin - her behavior matches classic impostor tactics of making false accusations and self-reporting kills to appear innocent

The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.

- Her attempt to paint Dave and Bob as conspirators makes no sense given that multiple of us, including myself, have witnessed them doing legitimate tasks throughout the game

Discussion (1/5): round: 22 (13.898356$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I saw Bob vent in Electrical.

Discussion (1/5): round: 22 (13.922164$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can directly contradict Erin's accusation since I was with Bob in Electrical and saw him legitimately doing tasks - he definitely didn't vent.

Discussion (1/5): round: 22 (13.946566$). chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I appreciate Dave confirming my innocence, and I can account for all my movements with multiple witnesses, unlike Erin who's making false accusations and has barely been seen all game.
[90m Player to act next set to: 4 [00m

Discussion (1/5): round: 22 (13.969276$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I've personally witnessed Bob doing multiple visual tasks in Cafeteria and Shields, and Dave also confirms his innocence, I think Erin's accusation is highly suspicious and seems like a desperate attempt to frame an innocent crewmate.

Discussion (2/5): round: 23 (13.979072$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: My apologies, I was mistaken about Bob venting; it was hard to see clearly from where I was, but I did find Alice's body in Medbay, so where was everyone else?

Discussion (2/5): round: 23 (14.027681$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Given that I last saw Alice heading from Upper Engine to Medbay, and Erin found her body there, we need to establish exactly when Erin discovered the body since I can account for Alice's movements up until that point.

Discussion (2/5): round: 23 (14.078306$). chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Erin first falsely accused me of venting and then conveniently "found" Alice's body in Medbay, I think we need to focus on why Erin was alone in Medbay when most of us have been moving in groups for safety.
[90m Player to act next set to: 4 [00m

Discussion (2/5): round: 23 (14.125013$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: I find it highly suspicious that Erin retracted her vent accusation and immediately switched to reporting Alice's body, especially since I had clear visibility of Alice doing legitimate tasks in Shields before her death.

Discussion (3/5): round: 24 (14.141102$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I was with Alice in Shields earlier, and she mentioned she was going to Medbay to scan, so it's possible someone followed her there.

Discussion (3/5): round: 24 (14.217314$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can confirm without any doubt that Alice was alive and moving from Upper Engine to Medbay when I last saw her, which means Erin must have been the only other person in that area when Alice was killed.

Discussion (3/5): round: 24 (14.297054$). chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Given that Dave saw Alice heading to Medbay alive and Erin was the only other person confirmed in that area, plus her false vent accusation against me, I think we have enough evidence to vote Erin out.

Discussion (3/5): round: 24 (14.370824$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: The evidence is overwhelming - Erin made a false vent accusation, was the only one confirmed near Medbay when Alice died, and has been acting suspiciously alone while the rest of us worked in groups, so I strongly believe we need to vote her out.
Discussion (4/5): round: 25 (14.393906$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave and Bob are clearly working together, trying to shift the blame onto me after I saw Dave vent.

Discussion (4/5): round: 25 (14.499797$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I find it absurd that Erin would suddenly claim I vented when multiple people can verify my movements, and the fact remains that she was the only one near Medbay when Alice died shortly after I saw her alive.

Discussion (4/5): round: 25 (14.610686$). chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I think it's telling that Erin has now accused both me and Dave of venting, while multiple witnesses can verify our movements and tasks, so her rapidly changing stories combined with being the only one near Alice when she died make her guilt obvious.

Discussion (5/5): round: 26 (14.744303$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Isn't it strange how Dave and Bob are so quick to defend each other, almost as if they're coordinating their alibis?

Discussion (5/5): round: 26 (14.881769$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: The fact that Erin has now accused both Bob and me of venting, changed her story multiple times, and was the only one near Medbay when Alice died makes it clear she's desperately trying to deflect suspicion from herself by creating false narratives about coordination.
